56: ## 1. Main Theorem (Statement)
57: 
58: :::{prf:theorem} Exponential HK-Convergence of the Fragile Gas
59: :label: thm-hk-convergence-main
60: 
61: Let the Fragile Gas evolve under the composed operator $\Psi_{\text{total}} = \Psi_{\text{kin}} \circ \Psi_{\text{clone}}$ on the space of sub-probability measures representing the alive swarm. Let $\mu_t$ denote the empirical measure at time $t$ and $\pi_{\text{QSD}}$ denote the quasi-stationary distribution.
62: 
63: Then $\Psi_{\text{total}}$ is a strict contraction in the Hellinger-Kantorovich metric. Specifically, there exist constants $\kappa_{HK} > 0$ and $C_{HK} < \infty$ such that:
64: 
65: $$
66: \mathbb{E}[d_{HK}^2(\mu_{t+1}, \pi_{\text{QSD}})] \leq (1 - \kappa_{HK}) d_{HK}^2(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) + C_{HK}
67: $$
68: 
69: **Implication (Exponential Convergence):**
70: 
71: $$
72: d_{HK}(\mu_t, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq e^{-\kappa_{HK} t/2} \cdot d_{HK}(\mu_0, \pi_{\text{QSD}}) + \sqrt{\frac{C_{HK}}{\kappa_{HK}}}
